fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62906].
  {panel}

We would really appreciate it if the Default Component Owner could be set to Assignee on Issues that are being edited/updated.
At this time the Default Component Owner can be set to Assignee only on Issue Creation, but not edit/update.

For us, we had built a business process around Bug/Product Issue triage, and then assignment to Engineering Teams to address the issue via the Component field. We had been under the impression that the Default Component Assignee would allow us to both notify and hand off ownership of the issues but alas it does not.
Without a native solution we will need to implement our own.

-Nick
fields.summary: Allow Default Component Owner to be set to Assignee when an issue is being updated/edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62905].
  {panel}

When I receive an e-mail from a JIRA filter-subscription, the e-mail contains:
-  a header with the filter's name, number of issues, filter's comment and subscriber
- a list of all found issues incl. a link to each individual issue
- a link to edit the filter subscription

What I am missing each time I receive the mail:
A link to the filter itself, so that I can see the list of issues in Jira.

This would safe me the procedure I do currently:
- open Jira in my browser
- go to the Issues -> manage filters
- look for the subscribed filters and
- click on it to see the list of issues

I need this list in Jira for:
- seeing more properties in the table
- doing bulk changes on some issues
...
fields.summary: Filter Subscription: The sent e-mail should also contain the link to the filter-query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62901].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

We cannot hide or manipulate preset filters from JIRA.

As an example, if you hide a field in JIRA and try to access a preset filter that uses that field, an error will show in JIRA. If a user is not aware that the field was disabled it can think this is an error or mistakenly access this filter.

h3. Solution

Create a way to disable the plugin's module responsible for these filters or a way for the user to hide it in the interface.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Hide system filters
When doing "Save As" for a filter, in addition to the name, also allow entering the summary, permissions, etc.
Add "Security Level" to Criteria for Issue Navigator
Extend JIRA REST API Search Request method

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62897].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When there are multiple custom fields with the same name on a screen, in the "Configure Fields" dropdown menu there will be only one option for all these fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two custom fields with the same name. For example, "TestCF".
# Create a project and associate the both "TestCF" fields to the Create Issue screen of that project.
# Create a new issue in that project, a Creste Issue popup will appear.
# In the Create Issue screen click on the "Configure Fields" menu.

h3. Expected Results
In the "Configure Fields" dropdown menu the "TestCF" custom field should appear twice.

h3. Actual Results
Only one "TestCF" field appears. (See screenshot below)
 !2016-10-20_configure-fields.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
When "Show All Fields" is selected, both custom fields with the same name are correctly displayed on the screen, however if "Show Custom Fields" is selected, only one "TestCF" custom field will be displayed if the option is checked.

h3.Workaround
Use different names for the custom fields on the same screen.
fields.summary: Same name custom fields appear only once in "Configure Fields"

h3. Problem Definition 
At the moment, it is not possible to configure the X-Y axis to use Created field and this gadget does not have the ability to specify the length of period represented on the graph.

h3. Suggested Solution 
* Created field should be included in the X-Y axis option so that the data of would be dynamically generated based on Created field. 
* Include the Period option as well so that user can have the ability to specify the length of period to be displayed on the graph.
fields.summary: Ability to use Created field and Period in Two-Dimensional Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62894].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, if a user is using the wrong credential when login multiple times they will prompt to input CAPTCHA if it is enabled. Then, if we refer to the page at _JIRA Administration > User Management > User_ we could see the "Failed Login Count" is increasing and Admin will be able to reset it. But, this will remain until the user is using the right credentials to login or an Admin resets the failed login count.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Hence, it will be great if there is a Configuration that will resets the failed login count automatically in a set period of time. Just like most login feature where the user needs to wait for 5 minutes for them to make another attempt to login, this will reset the failed login count.
fields.summary: "Reset Failed Login Count" to automatically reset in a set period of time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62893].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When trying to import the XML backup generated from the Cloud instance (1000.456.2) the restore process failed with a SQL syntax error of the {{CREATE TABLE}} statement. 

h3. Environment
* XML backup generated from Cloud instance 1000.456.2
* Target JIRA Server version : 7.2.2 (PostgreSQL)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an XML backup from Cloud instance.
# Import backup to JIRA Server instance.

h3. Expected Results
Restore process finished without any error.

h3. Actual Results
Following error in UI:
{code}
There was a problem restoring ActiveObjects data for the <unknown plugin> plugin. Importing table AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT failed. Please Check the logs for details.
{code}
!Screen Shot 2016-10-25 at 5.02.28 PM.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the log file:

{noformat}
2016-10-28 19:49:30,251 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 1186x326x1 1hy1inv 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported field encountered: binary
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported field encountered: binary
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BaseInserter.setValue(DataImporter.java:372)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.importTable(DataImporter.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.access$000(DataImporter.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withConnection(JdbcUtils.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.doImportNode(DataImporter.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

And

{noformat}
2016-10-19 13:36:47,196 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR administrator 816x98x1 6feeel 192.168.0.40 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin> (table AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT):Error executing update for SQL statement 'CREATE TABLE public."AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT" (
    "FILTER_CONFIGURATION" TEXT,
    "FILTER_CONFIG_HASH" INTEGER,
    "HASH" TEXT,
    "HIERARCHY_LEVEL" INTEGER,
    "ID" BIGSERIAL,
    "PLAN_ID" BIGINT,
    "REPORT_CONFIGURATION" TEXT,
    "REPORT_CONFIG_HASH" INTEGER,
    "REPORT_ID" TEXT,
)'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: syntax error at or near ")"
  Position: 295
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2101)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1834)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:255)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:510)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeUpdate(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:300)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 19 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The issue is caused by two tables which do not have a primary key defined:
* {{AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT}} which is used by JIRA Portfolio Plugin (This is a bundled system plugin in Cloud instance)
{code}
jira=> \d "AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"
                                 Table "public.AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"
        Column        |  Type   |                               Modifiers
----------------------+---------+------------------------------------------------------------------------
 ID                   | bigint  | not null default nextval('"AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT_ID_seq"'::regclass)
 HASH                 | text    | not null
 PLAN_ID              | bigint  | not null
 REPORT_ID            | text    | not null
 REPORT_CONFIGURATION | text    |
 FILTER_CONFIGURATION | text    | not null
 HIERARCHY_LEVEL      | integer | not null
 REPORT_CONFIG_HASH   | integer |
 FILTER_CONFIG_HASH   | integer |
{code}
* {{CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A}} which is used by a Cloud specific plugin.
{code}
jira=> \d CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A
Table "public.connect_plugin_modules_f4ed3a"
 Column | Type  | Modifiers
--------+-------+-----------
 data   | bytea | not null
{code}

Once we modified the {{activeobjects.xml}} file by setting a primary key to the relevant table, the error disappeared.

h3.Workaround
* If these tables do not contain any data, we can manually modify the {{activeobjects.xml}} file by removing both tables' definition and data:
** Search for {{"<table name="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT">"}} and {{"<table name="CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A">"}}, remove these two {{table}} entities.
** Search for {{"<data tableName="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT">"}} and {{"<data tableName="CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A">"}}, remove these two {{data}} entities.
* If there are any data in the {{AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT}} table, we can set the primary key to the ID column by searching for 
{code}
<table name="AO_D9132D_SHARED_REPORT"><column name="ID" primaryKey="false"
{code} and changing the {{primaryKey}} value from "false" to "true".
** Since the table {{CONNECT_PLUGIN_MODULES_F4ED3A}} is Cloud-specific we can remove it from the {{activeobjects.xml}} file as described in the above workaround.
fields.summary: Import Cloud backup to Server failed with SQL Exception due to missing primary key

+Issue Summary+

When using the bulk edit memberhsip provided by JIRA for group membership, typing the username of the user does not suggest users for selection.

+Steps to Reproduce+

# Click on Administration cog and select User Management
# Under User Management on the left select Groups
# Find a group and click on Edit Members under the Operations column
# Start typing users name in the Add Members box
# Observe that no suggested names appear

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

+Expected Result+

JIRA would automatically populate the search with list of users matching what you have searched for selection.

+Actual Result+

JIRA does not populate compatible users matching what you searched even when the username is completed however pressing enter when the name is complete adds the user to the group.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62876].
  {panel}

Scenario: -
--> Try to filter JIRA with component which contains a particular text like “ABC”
i.e. using filter [component ~ "ABC"]

You will notice that JIRA will give error as below: -
“The operator '~' is not supported by the 'component' field.”

Let us say I have many components starting with ABC like : - 
1) ABC-123
2) ABC-456
3) ABC-789
and so on.

If I want to filter JIRA using component field like [component ~ "ABC"]
It will give me above mentioned error.

To filter JIRA, I have to filter it using [component in ("ABC-123", "ABC-456", "ABC-789", ......... .....)], which is not user-friendly or I have to remember all components. If my admin has added few more, I would not know unless he/she tells me and I add those components in my already having filter with this in clause.

Another example is for https://jira.atlassian.com is , if I want to filter issues with component starting with/containing "Issue Navigation", I cannot do that.

So, there should be some way to filter component/labels using contains clause i.e. using ~
fields.summary: Ability to Filter Issues by component/labels but with contains/like clause. i.e. with ~ option.

h3. Problem Definition

After attaching .*mov* video file formats in an issue, clicking on it will *download* the file rather than *preview* it on the issue itself.

Unlike other video formats such as .*ogv* and *mp4* which do preview the video on the issue.

The same problem occurs with *.wav* file format.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to preview .*mov* video files and *.wav* audio files just like the rest of the video formats, instead of having to download the file in order to view it.
fields.summary: Ability to preview video and audio attachments in issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62872].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

* [Time Reports and Gadgets plugin developer/vendor, Andriy Zhdanov|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/120] has reported that they are experiencing a malfunction of the IssueLinkManager API in JIRA 7. 
* The problem is that issue object returned by IssueLinkManager is somewhat incorrectly initialized and is considered as SubTask, and has itself as parent issue.
* Basically the observation is that the issue object is incorrectly initialized in the *IssueLinkManager API* as a subtask. Notice from screenshot of a live debugging, how linkedIssue.isSubTask() is true, while cleanLinkedIssue.isSubtask() is false for the same issue.
!linkedIssue.png|thumbnail!
* According to customer same code works fine in JIRA 6, and only has this behaviour from JIRA 7.x. If there's at all need to make any reference to the plugin's source code, it is available at https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet, however, since it's our java API issue I'm assuming that may not be necessary. Relevant or affected code from our API can be seen from screenshot to some extent. 

*Worth to mention:*
Bug is in the method {{IssueLinkManager#getLinkCollection}}. All outgoing issues have parameter {{parent}} set to itself.
Introduced in [this|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/pull-requests/5475/overview] PR.
fields.summary: Issue object returned by IssueLinkManager is linked to itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62871].
  {panel}

Problem Definition
 For example, searching for {{-1d}} vs {{-24h}} in query gives completely different results. However this is not highlighted or explained in our documentation.
 * When specifying {{-1d}}, it will start calculating on the day when you executed it (which includes today itself if you execute the query now). It does not take into account the amount of time relative to the time you had executed it, ie 24 hours from the time you executed the JQL.
 * When specifying {{-24h}}, it will start calculating from the hour when you executed it, ie 24 hours from the time you executed the JQL.

Let's assume there is an issue that was transitioned to "Closed" yesterday 3PM, and the query is executed 1PM today:
 * {{status changed to "Closed" after -1d}} will not return the result but {{status changed to "Closed" after -2d}} will
 * {{status changed to "Closed" after -24h}} will return the result

Suggested Solution
 Include a section in Advanced JQL Search documentation to explain the differences.
fields.summary: Difference between Day & Time search is not explained in any JQL documentation
Markdown formatting
Reference pull request in Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62865].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there are two way for importing issues:
# Import issues from CSV (for all the users)
# External system import

If first option which is widely used by all the users in JIRA the issue key is not available in the drop down mapping field

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Mapping of Issue-Key for Import issues from CSV (for all the users) as we cannot provide administrator right to all the user to perform external system import(*JIRA Administration > system > external system import > CSV*).
fields.summary: Allow Mapping of Issue-Key for Import issues from CSV (for all the users)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62864].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian Jira Team!
 
We are using Kanban methodology, so we have no sprints, although we have a few tasks that should be done biweekely, on a selected day to make it a routine.
Scheduled issues could be the perfect solution for that.
Except the fact, that it literally seems impossible right now to schedule issues for every 2 weeks on mondays, using default or advanced cron expressions.

We tried: 
-  0 0 1-7,15-21 * 1  
- 0 0 1-7,15-21 * MON
and so many more. Jira did not accept these, only parts of that expression.

*Actual behaviour*: Setting a biweekly trigger for a selected day of week seems to be a missing basic feature at the moment. 
When we add e.g. second and last Mondays for trigger, sometimes it takes 3 weeks sometimes 2 weeks in between. Its not acceptable.
(second monday  of october is oct.10, last is october 31, that is 3 weeks, but for november the trigger would work)
 
*Expected behaviour*: Possible scheduled issue trigger biweekly on a chosen day of week, please. Would be nice as "Days per Biweek" as a preset schedule.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Make 2 weekly scheduled issues possible
Limit Statuses That Appear In Advanced Search
Jira Issues do not allow multiple assignees

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62859].
  {panel}

When you attempt to search for issues in JIRA with special characters ( - ) some issues are returned, however, not all issues are returned.

How to Replicate:

Create 5 issues:

test-test
test-1test
test-1test-1
test-25-test-2
test-322-test-4

Search for Search for summary ~ "test"

The results come back and the only issue that is found is test-test

The first issue is returned but the rest are not.

Attempting to escape the characters with \ or \\ per [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Search+syntax+for+text+fields#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] does not work.

A search for summary ~ "test*" returns the issues but also returns more results than the intended data set.
fields.summary: Escaping special characters in JQL search doesn't work

The JQL search for issues with attachments does not respect the Hidden status of the attachments.

Steps to Reproduce:
* Add an attachment to an issue
* Mark the attachment field as "hidden" in the field config scheme
* Search "project = FOO and attachment is not empty"

Expected Result:
Issue does not show up in the search result

Actual Result:
The issue appears in the search result

Workaround:
No Workaround.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62851].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA's default setting for jira.search.maxclauses is 65000. If JIRA has more than this amount in *Unrelased Versions*, boards will break with this error in the logs:
{code}
2014-03-16 20:03:11,778 http-bio-8080-exec-4 ERROR admin 1263x121x1 1b1c4rs 1.1.1.1.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json [greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl] A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException: A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
        at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.createLuceneQuery(DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:309)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:153)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy228.search(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy228.search(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findImpl(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:166)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findWithServiceOutcome(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getWorkDataIssueCountAndLastUpdated(WorkDataFactory.java:234)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getAllData(WorkDataFactory.java:141)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:59)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource.getPoolData(WorkResource.java:58)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
{code}

h4. Workaround
* Release/archive versions until the system is under the 65000 limit
or
* Increase the default limit of 65000, but it is not known how this will affect future performance of the system.
{code}
jira.search.maxclauses = 65000
{code}
fields.summary: Having a huge set of versions causes Boards to break

h3. Suggestion 
Currently, to use OAuth for REST API authentication, an application link must be created. This will be tedious especially if you have many developers (eg. 100+) who wants to use OAuth

Make it easier to generate an OAuth access token. For example, each user should be able to create a private access token from their user profile.

I would like to have the same column pre set in each pie slice as i have defined in the filter I used to create the pie chart.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62841].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using REST api perform the transition for closing an issue [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-doTransition|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-doTransition].
2. Go to issue navigator and search for all closed issues.

Expected Result:
The issue shows up in the search result

Actual Result
The issue does not appear in the search result.

Work Around:
Perform a re-index and the issue will appear in the search.
fields.summary: Issues closed through jira/rest/api/2/issue/{id}/transitions are not always reindexed
Allow customisation of width of Project list dropdown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62839].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62839].

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

When JIRA is waiting for the database to respond, the log will print:

{noformat}
2016-10-11 15:32:33,185 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] Running JIRA startup checks.
2016-10-11 15:32:33,185 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] JIRA pre-database startup checks completed successfully.
{noformat}

But if the DB is taking too long to respond or not responding at all, no timeout happen nor any entries in the logs to indicate this problem.

While it is possible to identify the problem with thread dups, we could log 'Attempting to connect with SQL Server' so JIRA Administrators know where to check if the startup process get stuck at this point.
fields.summary: Better messaging while attempting to connect to database in startup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62837].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there are no extra messages to debug the synchronization of a Crowd User Directory in JIRA.
Enabling com.atlassian.crowd.directory does increase the logging level when we have a Connector or Delegated directory, but using a Crowd directory does not log any extra messages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the same debug log messages logged for Connector/Delegated directories for Crowd/JIRA directories.
fields.summary: Increase JIRA synchronization with Crowd debug logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62836].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When you run a JQL search and then use the feature "Share this search result"
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.24.20.png|thumbnail! 
 the notification email will only display a link for the user to view the search results. 
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.23.01.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
 # To have a list of all tickets like JIRA does on filter subscription
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.26.01.png|thumbnail! 
 OR
 # Email a pdf with links to the tickets (still showing up all the tickets instead of just a link with the search results)

h3. Workaround

It's possible to create a JQL Query and save the filter. After, just ask for people to subscribe to that filter. This will only work for JIRA users.
fields.summary: Share this search feature should have the issues' list on notification email

Ability to see the owner of a shared Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62831].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When importing issues with CSV, JIRA should show a warning message before the import if the CSV contains issues whose all field values are empty.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 7.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project named "test" (whose project key is "TEST")
# Go to *Administration > System > Import and Export > External System Import > CSV*
# Import  [^test.csv] 
#- Select *Defined in CSV* as "Import to Project" option

h3. Expected Results
It would be nice if JIRA shows warning message *BEFORE* importing the CSV which contains issues whose all field values are empty.

h3. Actual Results
*AFTER* importing the CSV, JIRA showed "CSV row cannot be associated with any project" as follows.
 !csv-import.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The background of this feature request is that one of our customers said it would be nice if they could notice if there is something wrong with the CSV data *BEFORE* importing it.
fields.summary: When importing issues with CSV, JIRA should show a warning message before the import if the CSV contains issues whose all field values are empty

JIRA Data Center currently uses random ports to access other nodes, which can cause problems if there are security restrictions in place.

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62823].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The [_cascadingselect_ field type|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/configuring-plugins-with-object-configurable-parameters] does not work in the [reports plugin module|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/report-plugin-module]. A plugin attempting to use this field type will compile without problems, but no select input field will be rendered in the final report.
h3. Environment
 - JIRA 7.2.3;
 - OSX 10.11.2;
 - Chrome 53.0.2785.143.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plugin that utilises the [report plugin module|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/report-plugin-module].
 # Define a new report in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}, and specify a _cascadingselect_ field type (example below):
{noformat}
...
<property>
  <key>selectForCascade</key>
  <name>Select for cascade</name>
  <description>First part of the cascading field</description>
  <type>select</type>
  <values>
    <value>
      <key>happy</key>
      <value>Happy</value>
    </value>
    <value>
      <key>sad</key>
      <value>Sad</value>
    </value>
  </values>
</property>
<property>
  <key>aCascade</key>
  <name>Cascade select field</name>
  <description>Secondt part of the cascading field</description>
  <type>cascadingselect</type>
  <cascade-from>selectForCascade</cascade-from>
  <values>
    <value>
      <key>cat</key>
      <value>Cat</value>
    </value>
    <value>
      <key>dog</key>
      <value>Dog</value>
    </value>
  </values>
</property>
...




{noformat}

 # Navigate to the custom report.

h3. Expected Results

Two select fields should be present on the configure report screen (hardcoded values in the second select should come from a {{ValuesGenerator}} that depends on the value of the first select).
h3. Actual Results

No input field is rendered at all for the second select, and if a {{ValuesGenerator}} was used to populate the second select, it is never executed.  
h3. Workaround

According to [this Confluence Question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/128375/options-for-reports-using-cascading-select], the [eazyBI Reports Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.eazybi.jira.plugins.eazybi-jira/server/overview] can provide this functionality.
fields.summary: CascadingSelect field type is broken in core reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62820].

h3. Summary

Can't input Japanese characters correctly in Summary field on iOS app.

h3. Environment

* iOS app : v12.0.0.34
* JIRA Cloud : v1000.383.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to create (or edit) a issue
# Input Japanese characters in *Summary* field on the issue
#* e.g.) Input Japanese characters in the order of "あ", "い", "う", "え", "お"
# Input the same Japanese characters in *Description* field on the issue

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to input the Japanese characters correctly in Summary field as is in Description field.
(When it comes to the above example, the characters in Summary field should be shown as "あいうえお".)

h3. Actual Results

The characters in Summary field was shown as "ああいあいうあいうえあいうえお" even though the characters in Description field was shown correctly. Please see the following screenshot.

 !jira-mobile.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Can't input Japanese characters correctly in Summary field on iOS app

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA project the *Summary* page is in "Activity" view each time when user opens that page. There is a “Switch view” menu for changing to the "Statistics" view.
However there is no option to set the "Statistics" view as the default view for *Summary* page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to set the default view for *Summary* page.
fields.summary: Allow setting default view for project summary page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62773].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Solution.
When we try to authentication JIRA to another application for example from the Activity Stream, it will create another tab for the authentication process. Apparently, if we did not follow the authentication process from the new tab that is created from it and just used the tab for browsing another website when we tried to do the authentication again, it will reuse the same tab for the same process. This can lead the user to confusion as the previous page are suddenly changed or on some cases, it will stay on the same page while the page loads in another tab.

h3. Suggested Solution.
To create a new tab and redirect users to the tab when a user tries to authenticate to other application, rather than reusing any previous tabs that are originally for authentication as well.
fields.summary: Application Link Authentication to always create another Tab/Window and redirect user to it

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Change any date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in March (e.g 4/Mrz/15 10:25 PM)

*Expected Result:*
 - JIRA should be able to recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March

*Actual Result:*

*!march.png|thumbnail!*

*Possible Workaround:*
 - Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}

 - Change date manually to 20/Mär/15 or 20/März/17

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62768].
  {panel}

Most of our projects consist of multiple components with different versions.

h5. Example
* Release 1
** Component A in version 6.4
** Component B in version 1.8.7
** Component C in version 8.1
* Release 2
** Component A in version 6.8
** Component B in version 2.5
** Component C in version 9.0

Our customers will get a bundle of these components labeled "Release 1". This cannot be modeled in JIRA. JIRA only supports versions and components.

This feature request shall provide a way such that components and their versions can be bundled in a "parent version".

h3. Problem Definition
When configuring transition screens for a JIRA workflow, there is currently no way to provide a text snippet that describes the purpose, usage, etc. of the transition/screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
When creating/editing a Screen, either expose the "Description" field on the screen during a workflow transition or add a new field in the Screen create/edit process that will be exposed to users during a workflow transition.
 
h3. Workaround 
# Install the [JIRA Toolkit Plugin| https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.toolkit/cloud/overview]
# Create a Custom Field of the type "Message Custom Field"
# Define the text you'd like to have on your screen transition in the custom field
# Add the custom field to your Screen

{noformat}
On this case, we had the following row causing problems in the activeobjects.xml file.
{code:xml}
<row>
 <integer>3444</integer>
 <integer>7409</integer>
 <string>excerpt</string>
 <string>'Collect status' column has been commented out on Views\Collectors\Index.cshtml</string>
 </row>


{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Add a second backslash to the activeobjects.xml file to escape the one already present like the following, zip the activeobjects.xml and exntities.xml file back and restore JIRA again. [We wrote a script to automate this details in this comment |#comment-975282]
{code:xml}
<row>
 <integer>3444</integer>
 <integer>7409</integer>
 <string>excerpt</string>
 <string>'Collect status' column has been commented out on Views\\Collectors\\Index.cshtml</string>
 </row>


{code}
You should be able to find the problematic row to edit using a regex similar to the following replacing the "olle" part with the one in the error thrown
{noformat}
\\.olle
{noformat}

When we onboard a new project we often have to upload a batch of records from a spreadsheet. So it would be great if some extra validation could be added to the importers. Such as:
# Better pre-validation; the importer under Issues has validation but isn't great at it's jobs (from memory it doesn't import parent/child relationships). So we always resort to the Admin importer; which does not validate.
# The ability to import username by full name rather than ID would be great
# The option to NOT add values to dropdowns if encountered in the load but not stored in the system; i.e. allow the option to fail in validation or pass it through.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62745].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

The HTTP/1.1 connector defaults to blocking, which can cause a high number of CPU threads. 

h2. Solution
Confluence has already changed the default Tomcat connector to an NIO connector using {{org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol}}, JIRA should consider doing the same.
